searchDocs.title: Hook
searchDocs.content: Hook A hook handles sending messages to the webhook URL it is tied to. Note that you cannot change the URL the hook is tied to.

searchDocs.title: WebhookName​
searchDocs.content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> Message.WebhookName: string When this message is sent the webhook's name will appear as this. WARNING You are not meant to set this value maually. Please use Message:SetBotName to set this value

searchDocs.title: RawMessageContent​
searchDocs.content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> Message.RawMessageContent: string This is the normal raw text of the message, you can only have 1 per message. WARNING You are not meant to set this value maually. Please use Message:SetMessageContent to set this value

searchDocs.title: new​
searchDocs.content: </> Message.new() → () Create a new Message instance. This can later be passed into a Hook to send the message content to the hook's webhook

searchDocs.title: SetMessageContent​
searchDocs.content: </> Message:SetMessageContent(Content: string) → () This function allows you to add some normal text to your message.

searchDocs.title: SetBotName​
searchDocs.content: </> Message:SetBotName(Name: string) → () Sets the displayed name of the webhook when the message is sent

searchDocs.title: GetJSON​
searchDocs.content: </> Message:GetJSON() → ( boolean,-- Did it get encoded string-- Encoded message) ) Returns the message as a JSON string ready to be sent to the webhook
